thread.title: Amazon Prime Day: Score big with home appliance deals
thread.title_full: Amazon Prime Day: Score big with home appliance deals

author: Jeff Sherwood, Knoxville Business Examiner
title: Amazon Prime Day: Score big with home appliance deals
text:
Comment Amazon Prime Day will feature more home appliance deals than Black Friday when it kicks off on July 15, 2015. There will be thousands of deals in categories all across Amazon so shoppers will be able to get some great home appliances and more. Image courtesy of Amazon 
Looking for something new for the kitchen or other areas of the home? The Amazon Prime Day sale that will kickoff at Midnight PT on July 15, 2015 exclusively for Amazon Prime Members will feature several kitchen appliances as well as other home appliances shoppers will love. According to a July 14 press release , the sale will last for one-day and will feature thousands of items across all categories on Amazon. Shoppers will also be able to get unlimited free shipping during the event on all the hot items they buy. The Prime Day sale will feature more home appliance deals than the company offered on Black Friday and will feature thousands of deals that will sell out very quickly. 
Here is a preview of some of the featured home appliance deals shoppers will find during the Amazon Prime Day sale: Save up to 70% on select kitchen products from Cuisinart Save up to 70% on select kitchen products from KitchenAid Save up to 70% on select kitchen products Foodsaver and Thermos Save up to 70% on select kitchen products iRobot Roomba Pet Vacuum Cleaning Robot, under $300 Save more than 50% on Drinkwell Platinum Pet Fountain 
There will be hundreds of home appliance deals available during the Amazon Prime Day sale but some items will require faster action than others. The majority of appliance deals that offer deep discounts will be offered through Lightning Deals which thousands of other people will be competing for. Fast acting shoppers will be able to score some amazing deals while those who take too long to decide on a particular item risk losing out on getting it. These deals are typically gone in a matter of seconds. 
Although the Prime Day sale is exclusively for Amazon Prime members, Amazon is giving everyone a chance to get in on the action by allowing people to sign up for a 30-day free trial of Amazon Prime and get immediate access to all of the deals that are available. Shoppers will not only have access to the one-day sale but will also get to try out all of the other great features of Prime risk-free for 30-days. To see other items that will be included in the Amazon Prime Day sale take, a look at the sneak peek Amazon recently leaked giving a lineup of featured deals.
